title: Mock clawdbot control using OpenClaw Audit Proxy spec
description:
attached_molecule: de-wisp-avn
attached_at: 2026-02-04T19:50:00Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Replace the simple MCP bot agent with a clawdbot control interface based on the OpenClaw Audit Proxy spec.

**Spec**: ~/Downloads/openclaw-audit-proxy-spec.docx (copied to repo)

**Key Concepts from Spec**:
The audit proxy has 3 interception layers:
1. LLM API Proxy - intercepts all model requests/responses (HTTP reverse proxy)
2. Gateway WebSocket Tap - captures channel messages, session events, node ops
3. Tool Execution Wrapper - wraps shell commands, file ops, browser actions

Each produces AuditEvent records with:
- Hash-chained tamper-evident logging (SHA-256)
- Structured schema: seq, id, timestamp, layer, category, sessionKey, agentId, tool, input/output, status, duration, meta
- Fail-closed mode (block action if logging fails)
- SQLite WAL storage with export sinks

**What to Build (Mock/Demo)**:
- Replace the simple MCP bot control in the MSF2 frontend/agent with a clawdbot control interface
- Show real-time audit events from the agent (tool calls, LLM requests, actions taken)
- Implement the AuditEvent display in the UI (filterable by category, tool, status)
- Mock the 3 interception layers with simulated events or wire to the actual MCP agent's actions
- Show hash chain integrity visualization
- Support fail-closed/open/degraded mode toggle in UI

**Current Agent**: `agent/` directory, uses MCP protocol
**Frontend**: `frontend/` (Next.js at :3000)
**Docker**: msf2-agent container

This is a DEMO/MOCK implementation showing the concept, not the full production audit proxy.

comments.author: mayor
comments.text: Completed by Mayor. Created /audit page with OpenClaw Audit Proxy mock dashboard. Build verified.

title: Re-style MSF2 frontends to gateway.fm design language
description:
attached_molecule: de-wisp-0tl
attached_at: 2026-02-04T19:51:38Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Re-style all MSF2 frontend UIs to match the gateway.fm website design language.

**Design Reference**: https://gateway.fm

**Key Design Elements**:
- Font: Gotham family for headings, system fonts for body
- Colors: Dark text (near black), purple/indigo accents (#primary-medium), light slate gray backgrounds (#f1f5f9), white cards
- Cards: 2px border, border-radius 16-24px (rounded-2xl to 3xl), subtle shadow, p-6 to p-8 padding
- Buttons: Primary = dark bg + light purple/white text + rounded-full; Secondary = white bg + slate border
- Layout: max-w-[1248px] centered, generous whitespace, card-based grid (2-col mobile, 3-4 col desktop)
- Effects: Glassmorphic gradient backgrounds with blur effects
- Overall: Clean, minimalist, professional Web3 infrastructure aesthetic

**Frontend Location**: `frontend/` (Next.js app, served at :3000)

**Scope**:
1. Update global styles/theme (Tailwind config, CSS vars)
2. Update all page components to match design language
3. Ensure consistent card, button, and typography styles
4. Add gradient/blur effects where appropriate
5. Responsive mobile layout

comments.author: mayor
comments.text: Completed by Mayor. Restyled to gateway.fm design. Build verified.
